RelatedSentence: One of your articles has caused quite a stir !
For a couple of years now i have heard stories that people are been refused the right to get married @ the department of home affairs in Port Elizabeth .

I recently spoke to a couple i know who went there to get married married and then got turned away ,  All this couple wanted was to get married , i mean it has   been legal in  South Africa  since the  Civil Union Act  came into force on 30 November 2006 .

I recently spoke to a couple i know who went there to get married married and then got turned away ,  All this couple wanted was to get married , i mean it has   been legal in  South Africa  since the  Civil Union Act  came into force on 30 November 2006 .

The decision of the Constitutional Court  in the case of  Minister of Home Affairs v Fourie  on 1 December 2005 extended the  common - law  definition of marriage to include same - sex spouses - as the  Constitution of South Africa  guarantees equal protection before the law to all citizens regardless of  sexual orientation - and gave  Parliament  one year to rectify the inequality in the marriage statutes .

The decision of the Constitutional Court  in the case of  Minister of Home Affairs v Fourie  on 1 December 2005 extended the  common - law  definition of marriage to include same - sex spouses - as the  Constitution of South Africa  guarantees equal protection before the law to all citizens regardless of  sexual orientation - and gave  Parliament  one year to rectify the inequality in the marriage statutes .

My friend did eventually find somebody to marry him and his husband , but he was definitely let down here he was denied a service that would have been aloud by strait couples   , His dignity was tarnished and he was discriminated again on basis of his sexual orientation .
